examples.sentence: 〜といいですね - I hope (with ね)
〜たらいい - Would be good if

sections.heading: What is 〜といい?
sections.content:
〜といい (or 〜といいです ) expresses wishes, hopes, or gentle suggestions, meaning "it would be good if" or "I hope." It's softer and less direct than other advice patterns.

晴れるといいですね "I hope it clears up" / "It would be good if it cleared up" 早く治るといいね "I hope you get better soon" 合格するといいです "I hope you pass" / "It would be good if you passed"

children.heading: Pattern: Verb dictionary form + といい(です/ですね)
children.content: | Verb | Dictionary | + といい | | ------ | ---------- | ------------ | | 見る | 見る | 見るといい | | 食べる | 食べる | 食べるといい | | 来る | 来る | 来るといい | | する | する | するといい | | 行く | 行く | 行くといい | | 受かる | 受かる | 受かるといい |

children.heading: Also with negative form
children.content: 雨が降らないといいですね "I hope it doesn't rain" 遅れないといい "I hope we're not late"

children.heading: Use 1: Expressing wishes/hopes
children.content: 明日晴れるといいですね "I hope it's sunny tomorrow" 試験に合格するといいね "I hope you pass the exam" 元気になるといいです "I hope you get well" For someone else's benefit

children.heading: Use 2: Gentle suggestions/advice
children.content: もっと休むといいですよ "It would be good if you rested more" 医者に行くといいと思います "I think it would be good if you went to the doctor" 早く寝るといいよ "It would be good if you slept early" Softer than ほうがいい

children.heading: Casual: といい
children.content: 早く治るといいね "I hope you get better soon" Use with friends and family

children.heading: Polite: といいです
children.content: お元気になるといいですね "I hope you get well" General polite form

children.heading: More polite: といいのですが
children.content: お役に立てるといいのですが "I hope I can be of help" Humble and polite

children.heading: Example 1: Expressing Hope
children.content: A: 明日、遠足なんだ "We have a field trip tomorrow" B: 晴れるといいね "I hope it's sunny" A: うん、楽しみ！ "Yeah, I'm looking forward to it!"

children.heading: Example 2: Giving Gentle Advice
children.content: A: 最近、疲れが取れなくて... "I can't seem to shake off my tiredness lately..." B: もっと休むといいですよ "It would be good if you rested more" A: そうですね "You're right"

children.heading: Example 3: Wishing Well
children.content: A: 来週、面接があるんです "I have an interview next week" B: うまくいくといいですね "I hope it goes well" A: ありがとうございます "Thank you"

children.heading: Weather wishes
children.content: 晴れるといいですね - I hope it's sunny 雨が降らないといい - I hope it doesn't rain 暖かくなるといい - I hope it gets warm

children.heading: Health wishes
children.content: 早く治るといいね - I hope you get better soon 元気になるといいです - I hope you recover 風邪を引かないといい - I hope you don't catch a cold

children.heading: Success wishes
children.content: 合格するといいね - I hope you pass うまくいくといいです - I hope it goes well 成功するといい - I hope you succeed 見つかるといいですね - I hope you find it

children.heading: Health advice
children.content: もっと寝るといいですよ "It would be good if you slept more" 運動するといいと思います "I think it would be good if you exercised" 野菜を食べるといいよ "It would be good if you ate vegetables"

children.heading: Study/work advice
children.content: もっと勉強するといいね "It would be good if you studied more" 先生に聞くといいですよ "It would be good if you asked the teacher" 計画を立てるといいと思います "I think it would be good if you made a plan"

children.heading: Making it even softer
children.content: 休んだほうがいいと思います "I think you should rest" (direct) 休むといいと思います "I think it would be good if you rested" (softer) 休むといいんじゃないかと思います "I think it might be good if you rested" (very soft)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using た-form
children.content: Wrong: 行ったといい ❌ Right: 行くといい ✓ "It would be good if (you) went" Use dictionary form, not た-form!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using for your own wishes
children.content: Unnatural: 私が合格するといい ⚠️ Natural: 合格するといい ✓ Or: 合格したい ✓ "I hope I pass" といい is usually for others' benefit For yourself, use たい or hope implicitly

children.heading: Mistake 3: Too indirect for strong advice
children.content: When urgent: 医者に行くといいよ ⚠️ Better: 医者に行ったほうがいい ✓ "You should go to the doctor" といい is too soft for urgent situations!

children.heading: When receiving wishes
children.content: ありがとうございます "Thank you" そう思います "I think so too" そうなるといいです "I hope so" 頑張ります "I'll do my best"

children.heading: When receiving advice
children.content: そうですね "You're right" そうしてみます "I'll try that" 考えてみます "I'll think about it"

children.heading: といい (softest)
children.content: もっと休むといいよ "It would be good if you rested more" Gentle suggestion, expressing hope

children.heading: たらどう (casual)
children.content: もっと休んだらどう？ "How about resting more?" Casual advice

children.heading: ほうがいい (direct)
children.content: もっと休んだほうがいい "You should rest more" Direct recommendation

children.heading: べき (strongest)
children.content: もっと休むべきだ "You should rest more" (obligation) Strong obligation

children.heading: Hopes that something doesn't happen
children.content: 遅れないといいね "I hope we're not late" 失敗しないといいです "I hope you don't fail" 忘れないといい "I hope you don't forget" 風邪を引かないといいですね "I hope you don't catch a cold"

children.heading: Using といいのですが
children.content: お役に立てるといいのですが "I hope I can be of help" ご満足いただけるといいのですが "I hope you'll be satisfied" うまくいくといいのですが "I hope it goes well" More humble and polite!

children.heading: Shared feeling
children.content: 早く治るといいですね "I hope you get better soon" (we both hope) うまくいくといいね "I hope it goes well" (sharing the wish) ね adds warmth and empathy

children.heading: Before events
children.content: 試験、頑張ってね。合格するといいね "Good luck on the exam. I hope you pass" 明日の天気、晴れるといいですね "I hope tomorrow's weather is sunny"

children.heading: For ongoing situations
children.content: 早く仕事が見つかるといいですね "I hope you find a job soon" 問題が解決するといい "I hope the problem gets resolved"

children.heading: Even more casual
children.content: 晴れるといいな "I hope it's sunny" 合格するといいな "I hope I pass" Use with close friends or to yourself

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 明日晴れるといいですね "I hope it's sunny tomorrow" 早く治るといい "I hope you get better soon" うまくいくといいです "I hope it goes well"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: もっと野菜を食べるといいですよ "It would be good if you ate more vegetables" 遅刻しないといいね。急ごう "I hope we're not late. Let's hurry" 彼女と仲直りできるといいですね "I hope you can make up with your girlfriend"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: お体を大切にして、お元気でいられるといいですね "Please take care of yourself, and I hope you stay healthy" この提案が皆さんのお役に立てるといいのですが "I hope this proposal can be of help to everyone" 今回の経験が、あなたの将来に役立つといいと思います "I think it would be good if this experience helps your future"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜たほうがいい - Should/had better 〜たらどう - How about 〜といいですね - I hope (with ね) 〜たらいい - Would be good if 〜といいのですが - I hope (formal) Conditional と - If/when
